title: Why leavers don't get punished
body:
To start, I've been having a LOT (high%) of games with leavers recently. Now with that out of the way; I've reported some serious bad-eggs before, received messages saying that a player I reported has been punished. However, I've literally never seen someone have any back-lash for leaving a game, rage quitting etc and it made me think "Why is that?"

Honestly, in my opinion, leaving a game is the worst thing you can do aside from running into the tower and feeding type thing. Think about it, someone can talk shit in chat all they want, you can mute them, and you can still win/play the game, but if someone leaves, its a 99.9% chance loss. 4 players lose the game, and the other 5 players are denied satisfaction that they won fair and square.

So, why are leavers so easily forgiven? Well it got me thinking; It's all about plausible deniability. I mean, think about it: real life happens. Sometimes you get DC'd and can't reconnect, the power goes out, someone shows up at your house unannounced, your cats on fire. So when a player leaves, the leave is taken as "the player had no choice but to leave": We don't know the reason WHY they left, but we've got to give them the benefit of the doubt. Innocent until proven guilty right?

"We here at Riot don't want to be the bad guys and demonize or punish our loyal players when the situation was out of their hands, so, feel free to leave the game whenever you don't feel like playing anymore. As long as you don't leave too many in a row or '2 many/10'- we totally understand."

So my issue is this; I'm going to give a scenario: let's say league had a total player base of 10 players, so every game of league had the same 10 people playing each match. IF a player could leave once every 50 games without a punishment, that would seem pretty reasonable right? But now what if EACH of the 10 players took that liberty to leave one in 50 games. We'll say that 50 total games were played and each player took their one liberty to leave one game each. 10/50 (or 20%) those games would be 4v5's.

I don't know about you, but having 20% of games be 4 v 5's seems pretty damn high to me. I'm NOT saying that's what the leave rate ACTUALLY IS. (I'm sure it's lower than that for ranked at least.) But I'm saying: even allowing players to leave as often as 1 in 50 games could potentially make that the case (it's sure felt like that to me in my recent games lol) Especially for normal games because players KNOW they can get away with leaving, and it's not like they are losing LP, so who the fuck cares right?

To sum up: Can something be done about leavers? Or can their be something to promote people not leaving games: rewards etc? Maybe a badge or something like this:

<[{V}]> Virtuous Badge: This player has played 50 games in a row without leaving and receives: 10% increased IP and 10% increased Key fragment drop rate.

The only thing that would have to be done is if Riot could make a system that "Shows them" if you are trying to reconnect to a game when the problem is on their part.

replies.body: Took me just 4 dc's in a row to get a leave buster, and that was at a bots match.

That should probably be changed, because in bots matches it will remove one of the bots (sends them to fountain) if someone on your team DC's, which makes the game still fine for the other players on your team. But if someone actually keeps DC'ing from PvP games, I think they should probably wise up and not take the chance of F'ing everyone to "test" their connection

What can be done that isnt too harsh? You dont want to flat out ban these people (as that would be the only other punished we can give them) because too many people would be innocently ban. Then of course you seem to be under the impression that is only reason people leave is of a fault of their own. Riot has been known to have messed up servers. We have bugsplat errors, people cannot connect into their games. Why should someone get punished when they were not the reason for leaving? At least when someone leaves on their own, they know why they left and accept the consequences of leaving. Whereas if the fault isnt on you, why should you accept it?

As far as Riot goes, It would be their responsibility to know not punish you when it's on their part, I mean, when their servers go down they typically give a loss forgiven type thing. Even if you have a "legitimate" excuse for leaving, like having bad internet, I still think it should be the player's fault if they are knowingly playing with an unreliable connection.

But again, they wouldn't nesc even need to punish players more so than now, maybe just give them incentive to stay in games, like the badge thing I mentioned in the main post.

You keep saying "you shouldn't you be rewarded for a game you willingly opted into." Why is that?? Especially if you have opted into games OVER AND OVER and never left one of them. YES, yes you should get rewarded. 

It's like how stores have point cards for being loyal customers, if you get enough points you get rewarded. If you **don't** shop there commonly, your point card will never get filled out and expire as well. 

The IDEA here would be to reward players for **consistency**, not JUST for the half of random individual games that they didn't decide to leave.

I mean think about this, If you have a job in real life , yes you get rewarded for coming in each day and doing your job (paycheck) and if you skip work too often you get fired (leaver buster) but if you are a vigilant employee, don't skip work and do a decent job you get **promoted **

You see even, in real life people actually do get rewarded for their consistency. It just makes sense that: 

1. The common leavers get banned 
2. The occasional  leavers get smaller rewards
3. The consistent players get bigger rewards 

So im asking you this: hypothetically, If you had a $100 dollar bill, a $50 and a $1. and you **HAD** to give a bill to each player, the common leaver, the occasional leaver and the consistent player, who would deserve the $100? the $50? the $1?
